## Public Member Functions

### read() {#af22cc7ec55d3e7b68bf83856ed991f0e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ssize&#95;t raw&#95;socket&#95;stream::read (char &#42; Ptr, size&#95;t Size, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::chrono::milliseconds &amp; Timeout=std::chrono::milliseconds(-1))</>}>
Attempt to read from the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-socket-stream">raw&#95;socket&#95;stream</a>&#39;s file descriptor.

This method can optionally either block until data is read or an error has occurred or timeout after a specified amount of time has passed. By default the method will block until the socket has read data or encountered an error. If the read times out this method will return std::errc:timed&#95;out


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Ptr">The start of the buffer that will hold any read data</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Size">The number of bytes to be read</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Timeout">An optional timeout duration in milliseconds</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-socket-stream-h/#l00147">147</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-socket-stream-h">raw&#95;socket&#95;stream.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-socket-stream-cpp/#l00330">330</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/raw-socket-stream-cpp">raw&#95;socket&#95;stream.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
